subject: Languages
title: Sign Language in Ancient Civilizations
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Sign Language in Ancient Civilizations.

hook.text: Sign language didn't start in 18th-century France. Ancient civilizations already knew deaf people signed.

buildup.text: Plato discussed whether deaf people could communicate through gestures in his dialogue Cratylus.

discovery.text: Jewish law in the Talmud distinguished between deaf people who signed and those who didn't.
